abstract: The European Commission must decide in the coming days whether or not to issue formal charges against Oracle’s $7.4 billion offer to acquire Sun Microsystems — and neither of its options looks appealing.
snippet: The European Commission must decide in the coming days whether or not to issue formal charges against Oracle’s $7.4 billion offer to acquire Sun Microsystems — and neither of its options looks appealing.
lead_paragraph: The European Commission must decide in coming days whether to issue formal charges against Oracle’s $7.4 billion offer to acquire Sun Microsystems — and neither of its options looks appealing, The New York Times’s James Kanter writes.

headline.main: E.U. Faces Tricky Decision on Oracle Deal
